main event: A witness reported observing a bright, round, saucer-shaped object over Fort Worth, Texas, on August 13, 1952.
interesting points: The object appeared larger than a star, about the size of a 5 cent piece at arm's length.,It was estimated to be about 100 feet above the ground and approximately 30 feet in diameter.,The object was brightly illuminated with no sound evident during the sighting.,When it was directly overhead, it hovered for a moment before accelerating rapidly upwards and disappearing.,The witness is described as a credible observer who was excited but composed.
